Homes England required to appoint a Monitoring Surveying (MS) Firm from it's national Property Panel.  

The appointed MS is Jones Lang LaSalle and their work will include providing initial due diligence and ongoing monitoring of the residential development works.  

All work will be instructed under the standard terms of the HCA's Property Panel dated June 2018.

The Authority and the Torbay Economic Development Company Ltd trading as TDA, a company wholly owned by the Authority, are seeking professional support from appropriately qualified and experienced organisations to provide a range of property, planning and regeneration advice in support of the delivery of key projects to support delivery of the Council's town centre regeneration programme, delivery of urban extensions and delivery of the Council's Development Management service.

UKRI - had a requirement for the provision of Estates Professional Services including the preparation and development of an Estate Strategy

The Contract was awarded following the Direct Award Procedure under the CCS RM3816 Framework.

Working alongside its legal advisers, the TDA and Torbay Council officers, Torbay Council wishes to appoint an appropriately qualified and experienced consultant to support it throughout the process of procuring a development partner in respect of land at Little Blagdon Farm, Collaton St Mary, and Preston Down Road, Paignton. This will include assisting in the preparation of tender evaluation criteria and Heads of Terms; undertaking financial modelling; evaluating and advising upon tender submissions from prospective partners; attendance at meetings; and supporting the team generally throughout the Competitive Dialogue process.

Operating across the whole of the UK with a combined budget of more than £6 billion, UK Research and Innovation is a new entity that brings together nine partners to create an independent organisation with a strong voice for research and innovation, and a vision to ensure the UK maintains its world leading position in research and innovation. 
UKRI is committed to reducing the impact of travel and transport associated with its operations and is therefore seeking to procure a Consultancy to work with them to develop a Travel and Implementation Action Plan for its Swindon Campus (Polaris House). 
It should be noted that Implementation of the Travel Plan will be progressed by UKRI based on the mutually agreed Action Plan and that we are not looking to procure services beyond the initial consultancy. 
The overall aim will be to encourage staff and visitors to make travel choices other than the prevailing approach of single occupancy car for travel to Polaris House. Additional car parking provision is not an option being considered. 

UKRI is seeking guidance and support in relevant employee relations, Communications channels and staff engagement. 

The Plan should seek to find alternative solutions to solve the current problems of demand for parking and assist staff by making the

Birmingham Property Services is seeking a supplier for the provision of Rates Mitigation Strategy for city council owned commercial.
      
      The contract will be for a period of one year commencing Monday 25 February 2019 until 24 September 2019, with the option to extend for a further one year subject to requirements and funding.
      
      Award will be based on the evaluation criteria stated in the quotation pack. 
      
      If you are interested in tendering please click on the following link to access Birmingham City Council's tender portal:
      https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birmninghamcc/ and submit your details to register as a bidder.  We will send you a log on and password so you can download the Invitation to Quote.
      
      Your completed Quote should be returned by noon on Friday 8 February 2019.

The City of Wolverhampton Council (CWC) and Staffordshire County Council (SCC) as joint venture partners are inviting tenders for the provision of commercial property agency services in connection with the proposed marketing and sale of land to be prepared for development at I54 western extension.

Chorley Council is inviting tenders for commercial letting agent services for The Strawberry Fields Digital Hub at Euxton Lane, Chorley, a European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) project.  

The 5,000sqm/54,000sqft Hub is being developed by Chorley Council,  and is planned to open in November 2018.  Pre-marketing of the Digital Hub will be required to ensure that there are pre-lets, with businesses ready to move into the Hub by practical completion.  

Interested bidders should register their interest via the Chest at www.the-chest.org.uk in order to access the full specification and invitation to tender documentation.  The Contract shall be evaluated on the basis of the most economically advantageous tender (MEAT) criteria together with contractor suitability assessment. Full details of the evaluation criteria and methodology are included in the tender documents. The deadline for expressions of interest is 5.00pm on Friday 16th February 2018. Completed tender documents must be submitted and received via the Chest by no later than Noon on Monday 19th February 2018.

To assess redevelopment and refurbishment options for the Fleet Street Estate from expiry of the occupational leases in September 2023, to enable the formulation of an appropriate strategy for inclusion in the City Fund Property Investment Portfolio Strategy and the Business Plan for the site. The Police and Crime Commissioner for Lincolnshire (PCC) has a requirement to appoint a suitably qualified and experienced rating advisor to provide a comprehensive rating consultancy service, ensuring that:
•	The new 2017 rateable values and therefore rates liabilities are kept to minimum
•	Additional opportunities for rates savings are identified and acted on.
Capital Projects

London Borough of Newham (‘the Council’) wishes to appoint a suitably qualified consultant to provide property advice and support in relation to the Cabinet approved redevelopment of Carpenters Estate, Stratford, E15.
Capital Projects
CAPITAL PROJECTS
CAPITAL PROJECTS

Homes & Communities Agency ("HCA") is seeking to appoint a member of the HCA's national Property Panel to provide individual Red Book valuations for a number of sites which could be transferred into a Joint Venture ("JV") between the HCA and a medium sized national house builder ("house builder"). 

The house builder has identified 10 sites which could be transferred into the JV over the course of 2018 to deliver c.1,500 units. 8 sites are within the Midlands with 1 site in Yorkshire and 1 site in Lancashire. 

All work will be instructed under the standard terms of the HCA's Property Panel dated November 2014.

The Hyde Construction Consultancy Services Framework is being procured covering a range of services for construction projects and will be accessible by other Public Bodies throughout England and Wales. 
      Hyde wishes to establish a Framework Agreement for use by the following UK public sector bodies (and any future successors to these organisations):
      
      A full list of potential contracting authorities can be found here under the most recent file:
      https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/nationalaccounts/uksectoraccounts/datasets/publicsectorclassificationguide
      
      The following public bodies may also use the Framework Agreement:
      http://www.wales.com/study/universities-wales

The Sovini Group ("Sovini") invites tenders for organisations ("Service Providers") to participate in a 48 month agreement ("the agreement") for the provision of Development Consultancy Services ("Services"). The range of Services to be supplies are detailed within the tender documentation. The Agreement will be used by Sovini and all subsidiaries of Sovini, both current and future. The Agreement may also be accessed by other Contracting Authorities, including other Registered Providers of Social Housing operating across the North-West of England.

Framework agreement for the supply of financial advisory services which covers a wide range of financial advisory services including general finance, tax advisory, treasury management, financial analysis and real estate and strategic asset advisory.

Framework agreement for the supply of financial advisory services which covers a wide range of financial advisory services including general finance, tax advisory, treasury management, financial analysis and real estate and strategic asset advisory.

Framework agreement for the supply of financial advisory services which covers a wide range of financial advisory services including general finance, tax advisory, treasury management, financial analysis and real estate and strategic asset advisory.

The Homes and Communities Agency (HCA) is seeking to appoint a national framework agreement of property professional and technical service providers to provide the full range of property services including acquisition and disposal services, estate management services, investment and financial services, valuation services, lead and project management services and general professional advice and support. The framework is for 4 years and it envisaged that there will be 20 suppliers. Individual project appointments from the framework will be either be via direct award or further competition.  Note services will only be procured within England.

The University of Leicester is seeking to implement a framework agreement for provision for Building Surveying Consultancy Services. The requirement is split into 2 lots based upon size of projects.
  The University of Leicester is seeking proposals from suitably qualified and experienced Building Surveying consultancy practices to provide a range of specialist property and construction professional, managerial and administrative functions, including the necessary administrative support and resources to provide strategic service and to implement its capital programme.
  The University requires all tendering consultants to be capable of delivering Traditional or Design and Build Refurbishment projects under Joint Contracts Tribunal (JCT) contracts. Additionally the consultants must be capable of delivering projects of different complexities, for example work on science laboratories, residential buildings and teaching spaces.

The University of Bristol has appointed Perfect Circle JV Ltd for the provision of services in regard to the Concept Design for the academic and residential accommodation within the Temple Quarter Enterprise Campus. 

This appointment is a call off from the Scape Group National Built Environment Consultancy Services (BECS) framework, made between Scape Procure Limited and Perfect Circle JV Ltd. 

Perfect Circle JV Ltd intends to appoint Aecom Infrastructure and Environment UK Limited as the Principal Supply Partner, to carry out the services on behalf of Perfect Circle JV Ltd.

As Principal Supply Partner, Aecom Infrastructure and Environment UK Limited intends to appoint the following Sub-consultants, including: Feilden Clegg Bradley Studios LLP; Buro Happold Limited; Grant Partnership Ltd and Jones Lang LaSalle Ltd to provide elements of the services within their respective professional disciplines.
